title: Lens Technology accelerates Liquid Cooling Innovations for AI Systems
description: HONG KONG SAR - Media OutReach Newswire - 18 August 2025 - The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence has significantly increased GPU power demands, leading to a substantial rise in power consumption across data centers, from individual GPU chips to entire server racks. This surge in power usage has resulted in heightened heat generation. Liquid cooling technology, utilizing direct or indirect liquid contact with heat-generating components, delivers superior thermal dissipation efficiency. This capability effectively addresses the rigorous thermal management needs of server racks and data centers, positioning liquid cooling as the essential solution for next-generation high-performance computing servers.
content: HONG KONG SAR - Media OutReach Newswire - 18 August 2025 - The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence has significantly increased GPU power demands, leading to a substantial rise in power consumption across data centers, from individual GPU chi... [2866 chars]

title: Anthropic reaches a settlement over authors' class-action piracy lawsuit
description: The move means the company will avoid a potentially more costly ruling if the case regarding its use of copyright materials to train artificial intelligence tools had moved forward.

title: Here’s what we know (and don’t know) about AI and jobs
description: A report out of MIT last week claimed that 95 percent of companies had wasted money with failed projects relying on generative artificial intelligence apps. Someone should have read the fine print.
content: Digging into the details of the MIT study revealed some squishy data being used to support the startling headline conclusion. And a new study out of Stanford’s Digital Economy Lab on Tuesday using vastly more data made the opposite point: AI is likel... [3958 chars]

title: Study says AI chatbots inconsistent in handling suicide-related queries
description: A study of how three popular artificial intelligence chatbots respond to queries about suicide found that they generally avoid answering questions that pose the highest risk to the user, such as for specific how-to guidance. But they are inconsistent in their replies to less extreme prompts that could still harm…
content:
